newsitem.title: UK: Italy's Bertinotti sketches privatisation deal.
newsitem.headline: Italy's Bertinotti sketches privatisation deal.

text.p: The leader of Italy's hard-left Communist Refoundation party on Friday sketched out a possible deal with the government on privatisation.

Fausto Bertinotti told reporters in London that a "useful compromise" might be possible under which the privatisation of state telecoms company Stet could be balanced by the retention of public control of the energy sector.
Bertinotti's party holds the balance of power in Italy's lower house of parliament. It backs Prime Minister Romano Prodi's centre-left coalition but remains outside the government.

The sale of Stet has been delayed by parliament's inability to approve legislation creating a watchdog body for the sector. Bertinotti has previously said he hoped the state would keep a 51 percent stake in Stet.
Italy is expected to sell a third tranche of shares in energy giant ENI by the summer but is expected to retain overall control. Its current stake is 69 percent.
The government also wants to privatise electricity utility Enel, a move which Bertinotti opposes.
